Description: Ambulance service, conventional air services, transport, one way (fixed wing)
Ambulance service, conventional air services, transport, one way (rotary wing)
Fixed wing air mileage, per statute mile
Limits: One way, per flight, equally divided by the number of clients transported.

Description: Rotary wing air mileage, per statute mile
Limits: One way, per flight, equally divided by the number of clients transported.

Description: Ambulance service, basic life support, non-emergency transport (BLS)
Limits: Origin and destination modifiers required.  For each additional client, use modifier GM in addition to the origin and destination modifiers.

Description: Ambulance service, basic life support, emergency transport (BLS-emergency)
Limits: Origin and destination modifiers required.  For each additional client, use modifier GM in addition to the origin and destination modifiers.

Description: Ambulance service, advanced life support non-emergency transport, level 1 (ALS 1)
Limits: Origin and destination modifiers required.  For each additional client, use modifier GM in addition to the origin and destination modifiers.

Description: Ambulance service, advanced life support, emergency transport, level 1 (ALS 1 emergency)
Limits: Origin and destination modifiers required.  For each additional client, use modifier GM in addition to the origin and destination modifiers.
Origin and destination modifiers required.  For each additional client, use modifier GM in addition to the origin and destination modifiers.
Origin and destination modifiers required.  For each additional client, use modifier GM in addition to the origin and destination modifiers.

Description: Transportation ancillary: parking fees, tolls, other Invoice required.
Extra ambulance attendant, ground (ALS or BLS) or air (fixed or rotary winged); (requires medical review)
Limits: Pertinent documentation to evaluate medical appropriateness should be included when this code is reported. Origin and destination modifiers required. Justification required: * The client weighs 300 pounds or more; or * Client is violent or difficult to move safely; or * More than one client is being transported, and each requires medical attention and/or close monitoring. Note: DSHS pays for an extra attendant in ground ambulance transports only.  No payment is made for an extra attendant in air ambulance transports.

Description: Ambulance response and treatment, no transport
Limits: Code not payable.  Used for data collection purposes only.
